articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Relative moderate Masoud Pezeshkian urged people on Saturday to stick with him on "the difficult road ahead" after beating a hardline rival to win Iran's presidential election.
articles.title: Moderate Pezeshkian wins Iran presidential election, urges people to stick with him

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas has accepted a U.S. proposal to begin talks on releasing Israeli hostages, including soldiers and men, 16 days after the first phase of an agreement aimed at ending the Gaza war, a senior Hamas source said on Saturday.
articles.title: Hamas agrees to proposal on talks to free Israeli hostages 16 days after first phase, Hamas source says

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield, Sunil Kataria
articles.description: In a monastery beneath snow-capped mountains in northern India, the Buddhist monk entrusted with protecting the Dalai Lama and foretelling his people's future is concerned.
articles.title: As the Dalai Lama turns 89, exiled Tibetans fear a future without him

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said on Saturday that China's largest coastguard vessel has anchored in Manila's exclusive economic zone (EEZ) in the South China Sea, and is meant to intimidate its smaller Asian neighbour.
articles.title: China anchors 'monster ship' in South China Sea, Philippine coast guard says

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Jordan Bardella has helped steer France's far-right National Rally (RN) toward its first real chance of power, the rapidly emerging fresh face of a party that has sought to clean up its image and widen its appeal in recent years.
articles.title: Le Pen's investment in far-right Bardella pays off ahead of French election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Saudi Arabia's king and crown prince congratulated Masoud Pezeshkian on his election as Iran's president, state news agency SPA reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Saudi crown prince keen to develop Iran ties following Pezeshkian's election, state news agency says

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Steve Holland, Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Friday said he did not need a cognitive test to determine whether he had a mental decline and dismissed calls from some Democrats that he should step aside to let a more vigorous candidate take on Republican Donald Trump.
articles.title: Defiant Biden says won't leave race, doesn't need cognitive test

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran's president-elect, low-profile moderate Masoud Pezeshkian, carries the hopes of millions of Iranians seeking less restrictions on social freedoms and a more pragmatic foreign policy.
articles.title: Who is Masoud Pezeshkian, Iran's new president-elect?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Saturday confirmed his newly formed government would not pursue his predecessor's policy to deport asylum seekers who arrive in small boats to Rwanda, ending the scheme before any flights took off.
articles.title: New UK PM Starmer confirms end of Rwanda asylum deportation scheme

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sonia Dahmani, a prominent Tunisian lawyer known for her criticism of President Kais Saied, has been sentenced to one year in prison, her legal representative said on Saturday.
articles.title: Tunisian court jails prominent critic of president
